intro: Acinodendron ternatifolium, commonly known as the three-leaved acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters. Acinodendron ternatifolium is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
